reviews.review_msg: I honestly don't know why her ratings are so low. Dr. Marchbank was a great prof! She has lots of firsthand knowledge about feminism, super interesting to listen to. Assignments were easy, and the way the grades were divided, you could not do well on the midterm and still do great overall in class. Stay up to date on readings and you will be fine!
Very disorganized course. Besides that the marking was fair but there were so many assignments, readings, podcasts, and lectures. Way too much for a first year course.

seemed like a fun and easy class but there was too many small/time consuming assignments. everything was submitted through email (not canvas which is so weird) and that made everything so unorganized in terms of receiving marks etc. her class was all over the place and she sent emails fixing her mistakes nearly every week (missing lectures etc)

so many assignments for an elective course. The marking criteria is super unclear and TA's are not helpful in terms of feedback. Her recorded lectures include way too much info that she just skims past. Lots of readings, discussion posts, and other various assignments. I recommend only if you're into feminism, other that that shes a tough prof.

Do not recommend this class unless that is what ur majoring in & are into feminism. No midterm & the final is cumulative & no one in the class has any idea as to what will be on it as the lectures are super heavy with a million readings a week. Everything is emailed to you so attendance is not required as there is nothing u learn in class imo.

Very friendly, very open-minded. Group presentation wasn't terrible. Our midterm wasn't really a "midterm", she kept insisting they were in-class assignments, but they were practically tests. Had a good time though, and got to do a creative project for the final project!

The workload is pretty doable and the TAs mark fairly and are very approachable (as is Jen). I would recommend this class to anyone - Jen and the TAs are awesome! If you put the work in you will get a good grade. Final may be worth 40% but I had another elective this semester with final worth 50%. This is university people, get used to it.

Honestly this course is too much work. Jen is not really helpful in terms of what she expects from assignments and the final exam, neither are the TAs (in my opinion). Do not take this course the final is worth 40% and consists of 30MC and 2 essay questions which is a bit much for an elective course.

Tutorials are the most interesting part of this class. Her lectures are boring, and too much information. She should focus on the more important things. Everyone in the class is anticipating the final because its worth so much and we havent had much feedback in the course.

Course consists of 4 500 word assignments, one class presentation, an 8 paged paper and a final exam worth 40% of your grade. This class is too much work for an elective. It would be much more fair if the final wasn't worth 40 percent of your grade. That should not even be allowed. This course is designed very POORLY for a lower level elective.

This is a easy course it just requires EFFORT. All you have is a tutorial presentation (already finished), four artefacts (already finished), 8 page essay, and a final. All I have to do is my essay and the final. Jen is pretty crystal clear at explaining concepts but then again it's not rocket science. Tutorials are useless but mandatory but o well

Jen was a great prof.  Lectures were engaging and interesting.  Clearly stated her expectations for the paper and the final during lecture.  She gave a detailed list of what to write on every topic ONLY in lecture.  So you need to show up.  Lots of great discussion in tutorial.

Jen is nice, though her accent tends to be difficult to understand. Content/reading can be repetitive and dry. no midterm. 1 8paged essay but grading and criteria not clear cut. Tutorials were pointless but counts as participation mark
The prof is nice, but the essay grading is difficult to catch, quite subjective. However, those t.a are very helpful.

Super adorable, and easily of the nicest and most caring profs I've had. Keeps her lectures simple but informative. There's one 8 page paper, no midterm, and a 40% final, but she basically gives you everything you need to prepare for the final beforehand. Her accent makes everything 10x more interesting too!

Stressed. She sucks you in with the whole one paper one exam idea but fails to let you know there will be about 150000 readings a week. Not easy. Not to mention content is dry. Extremely time consuming course. I'm sure she is a great lady though!

Boring boring boring. Readings are super dry, tutorials are essentially pointless, feel like she just rambles during the lectures. Theres a research essay instead of a midterm, but its hard to do either when you haven't learned much. Don't take 102 with her!
She is a great teacher but the class material is quite dry.

JEN IS THE MOST AMAZING PROF! Take her class if you're a first year student! Her lectures are very interesting & engaging. She is very friendly & always available for extra help. By second semester all the explorations students are battling to get into her class.  Jen is fabulous all around, and also has a beautiful Scottish accent :)

She is amaaaaaaaaazing:D She is always available for extra help and she gives great feedback on students works and her guidance is really helpful:)Lectures are not boring and she is very patient and goes over all the slides and explains them well:) One of the best:)
Wonderful professor, has such a high level of passion for what she teaches, and is always available for extra help :) Good job Jen, another successful semester!
Very helpful prof. Her tutorials helps a lot.

She's really nice, friendly, helpful, passionate, understanding, calm, clear and was great for a my first year class! I love her Scottish accent!! Had to stop myself from imitating it, it was a great class!!

Excellent first year prof! Her exams and quizzes are strictly from the courseware so make sure  you keep up with readings (seriously, dont get lazy). A lot of group work as well which can have its downsides, however..her marking scheme is excellent and she's clear with the concepts and very helpful! Give some effort and you can definitely get an A!

Take her in first year at least - you will be the better for it! Fascinating and useful material. A bit heavy on group work, maybe, but if it's something we all have do to, you'll want to do it first in her class. Incredibly accommodating.
great professor! her tutorials are really helpful.

The content of Explorations 130 Global Development was interesting and comprehensive. It covers industrial revolution, women's issues, tourism, etc. Jen has a strong accent, but you do get used to it after a few lectures. The exams are written, so memorize memorize memorize! Fun assignments with fair marking.
Good teacher, clear and fairly interesting lessons. Her exams and quizzes can be hard. Make sure you read the coursework.

Very good proffessor, she knows what she's talking about, actually cares about what she is teaching and is helpful to her students. She is a very good public speaker and her concepts are easy to understand. I would recommend this course to any first year student.

Excellent proff, throughly enjoyed going to class, Lectures and Tutorials were fun and engaging, very fair and understanding.  Very intelligent and knowledgeable, highly recommend taking a class with her
Great material. Great Prof. She cares about students, fair marker, willing to help student. Movie, lectures, discussion, assignment are student friendly. BEST PROF I EVER HAD

Jen is one of the best prof i ever had. She is passionate and knows what she's talking about. It's not boring. She respect students and cares about what you have to say. The class structure is student friendly. Marks are very fair if you put effort. It's an eye opening class and you will enjoy.

She asks a lot of questions in here lectures that she doesn't seem to give answers for-- doesn't appear to have a good grasp of her subject matter although I believe this appearance is deceiving. A little on the uber-feminist side, I guess too. Her quizzes are really simple and straightforward.

Jen Marchbank - awesome! She's a little hard, but as long as you do the readings and attend lectures, it shouldn't be hard to get a good grade in her class. She's very knowledgeable and she's extremely friendly. I really enjoyed women's studies with her.
SHE IS AWESOME :):)

Be prepared for some feminist teaching indeed, of the radical kind, in a first year course intended for business/ arts/ majors. (!) She definitely has her like minded fans, but some of us wanted a bit more objectivity, particularly on globalization, politics
Also had her for EXPL 130 and 150. Great prof, definitely my favourite. She TEACHES you how to do what you're supposed to do. Unlike so many profs out there. Amazing.
Best prof EVER... totally agree about the motherly-ness!
I love Jen! She is awesome! She's very passionate about what she teaches. She is also very understanding and motherly :)
Jen is very passionate about women's issues in all of her courses. She's a great prof, but whatever she teaches, be prepared for some feminist content. She's helpful and genuine. Thumbs up.
